channel.title: Christopher Paul Morrison
channel.description: Thoughts on technology, leadership, and building things that matter.

item.title: Building in Public
item.description: There's a certain vulnerability to sharing your work before it's ready. But the feedback loops you create by building in public are worth far more than the comfort of secrecy.

item.title: Lessons from Leading Teams
item.description: After years of leading engineering teams, I've learned that the best managers don't manage work — they create the conditions where great work happens naturally.

item.title: The Art of Simplicity
item.description: The hardest part of software design isn't adding features — it's knowing what to leave out. Simplicity is a discipline, not a default.
